abstract: Debt ratings for 18 United States banks, including Wells Fargo and KeyCorp, were cut by Standard & Poor’s on Wednesday.
snippet: Debt ratings for 18 United States banks, including Wells Fargo and KeyCorp, were cut by Standard & Poor’s on Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: Forecasting a more challenging and less profitable climate ahead for the nation’s lenders, Standard & Poor’s said Wednesday that it was downgrading and revising its rating outlooks on 17 regional banks in the United States as well as Wells Fargo, the banking giant that recently bought Wachovia.

headline.main: S.& P. Cuts Ratings on 18 Banks
